Package tage.rml

Interface Matrix4

All Known Implementing Classes:
Matrix4f
public interface Matrix4
This interface defines the operations for a square 4x4 matrix.

Implementations are meant to use a column-major layout. This is the standard convention followed by mathematical texts and OpenGL/GLSL.

This interface implies this convention by the overloaded mult(Vector4) method expecting a vector, where the vector being multiplied is on the right side of the matrix. In other words, a matrix M and a vector v} must be multiplied as v' = Mv to produce a new column-vector v' as the output.

Author:
Raymond L. Rivera

  • Method Details

    • value

      float value(int row, int col)
      Returns the scalar value at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
      col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
      Returns:
      The scalar value found at the specified location.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either index is outside the [0, 2] range.

    • row

      Vector4 row(int row)
      Returns the specified matrix row as a vector instance.
      Parameters:
      row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
      Returns:
      A vector with data from the specified row.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the row index is outside the [0, 3] range.

    • column

      Vector4 column(int col)
      Returns the specified matrix column as a vector instance.
      Parameters:
      col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
      Returns:
      A vector with data from the specified column.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the column index is outside the [0, 3] range.

      Matrix4 add(Matrix4 m)
      Add the specified matrix to this matrix.
      Parameters:
      m - The matrix that will be added to this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this addition.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Parameters:
      m - The matrix that will be multiplied by, or concatenated to, this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this multiplication.

      Returns:
      A new matrix with the specified rotation applied.

      A new matrix with the specified rotation applied.

      Parameters:

      axis - A vector instance specifying the axis of rotation.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the specified rotation applied.

      tz - A scalar value by which to translate this matrix on the z-axis.

      A new matrix with the translation applied.

      Parameters:

    • determinant

      float determinant()
      Returns the determinant of this matrix.

      Note that if the determinant is zero, then this matrix is singular and cannot be inverted.

      Returns:
      The determinant of this matrix.

    • inverse

      Matrix4 inverse()
      Returns a new matrix that is the inverse of this matrix, if possible.

      If this matrix is a singular matrix, then it's not possible to calculate its inverse.

      Returns:
      The inverse of this matrix.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If this is a non-invertible matrix.

    • transpose

      Matrix4 transpose()
      Returns a new matrix that is the transpose of this matrix.

      Transposing a matrix means swapping the columns with the rows.

      Returns:
      The transpose of this matrix.

    • toMatrix3

      Matrix3 toMatrix3()
      Extract the upper left 3x3 sub-matrix from this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix instance from the upper left values of this matrix.

    • toQuaternion

      Quaternion toQuaternion()
      Extracts a quaternion with the orientation represented by the upper 3x3 rotation matrix within this matrix.
      Returns:
      The rotation in this matrix as a quaternion.

    • toFloatArray

      float[] toFloatArray()
      Returns an array with a copy of the object's internal values.
      Returns:
      A copy of the object's internal values as an array.
